title: [Munitions and armaments parade]
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Australia. Army

Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/War - History
abstract: A highly attended public parade of Australian made armaments and munitions down a main street of Melbourne.
description: Taken in long shot from a high angle, the following armaments pass by the camera: 3.7 inch Anti-Aircraft (A/A) guns and transporters, 40mm Bofors A/A guns, 2 Pounder Anti-Tank (A/T) guns mounted on Quad trucks, 6 Pounder A/T guns, Bren gun carriers, Dingo Scout cars and Sentinel tanks, produced at Fisherman's Bend. Australian industry did not have the capacity to bend armour plate of the type required by a cruiser tank and so the Sentinel’s makers took the revolutionary step of casting the hull. The Sentinel was a powerful weapon; unfortunately, it did not see action, as Australian armoured units were supplied with US equipment before it could be put into production.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2002521; Australia at War: 1942; Active; 2012
